Fluence (Nasdaq: FLNC) is a global market leader in energy storage products and services and digital applications for renewables and storage. With a presence in 30 global markets, Fluence provides an ecosystem of offerings to drive the clean energy transition, including modular, scalable storage products, comprehensive service offerings, and the Fluence IQ platform, which delivers AI-enabled digital applications for managing and optimizing storage and renewables. The company is transforming the way we power our world by helping customers create more resilient and sustainable electric grids. For more information, please visit fluenceenergy.com .OUR CULTURE AND VALUESWe are guided by our passion to transform the way we power our world. Achieving our goals requires creativity, diversity of ideas and backgrounds, and building trust to effect change and move with speed.We are Leading Fluence currently has thousands of MW of energy storage projects operated or awarded worldwide in addition to the thousands of MW of projects managed by our trading platform—and we are growing every day.We are Responsible Fluence is defined by its unwavering commitment to safety, quality, and integrity.We are Agile We achieve our goals and meet our customer’s needs by cultivating curiosity, adaptability, and self-reflection in our teams.We are Fun We value the diversity in thought and experience of our coworkers and customers. Through honest, forthcoming, and respectful communications we work to ensure that Fluence is an inclusive and welcoming environment for all.This position will be within the Fluence Digital business unit, formed following Fluence’s acquisition of San Francisco-based start-up AMS. Fluence Digital’s IQ platform uses artificial intelligence, advanced price forecasting, portfolio optimization and market bidding to ensure energy storage and flexible generation assets are optimally participating in wholesale electricity markets.About The PositionThe Director, Global Services Training will drive the Global Training Service business along two fronts. They will lead the effort to externally commercialize industry leading BESS content. They will additionally ensure efficient delivery of all obligated internal product training through continuous innovation and training product delivery improvement. As such, this position is key to both Fluence and Customers alike and will interface with internal and external stakeholders regularly. This position will report to the VP, Global Services. As the Director, Global Services Training, you will:Own global Training income statement for obligated and new revenue training worksDevelop and own execution for Training business plan to achieve commercialization of digitized training content globallyPartner with regional Sales teams in driving external training revenue to existing and new customersDevelop and maintain training e-commerce platform, associated Fluence Academy and LMS support sufficient to provide training services digitally and in-person consultingLead internal training team to deliver high value technical training presentations, webinars, worksheets, and workshops to internal and external customers.Manage both sides of business proactively and quantitatively through Training business KPI dashboard and metrics.Continually propel Fluence training body of knowledge, procedures, and systems forward through continuous innovation and systematic improvementsPerform hands-on training on-site or at a training facility and include job performance measure evaluations of trainees, as required.What will our ideal candidate bring to Fluence? Undergraduate degree required with strong preference for technical or graduate degree.Must have experience leading global training teams in fast paced entrepreneurial environments.Must demonstrate strong track record of developing and deploying cutting edge training content through variety of digital mediums.Must possess commercial mindset with ability to identify revenue generating opportunities and customer value creating solutions.Must be willing and able to travel up to 50% of the time in support of training schedules.Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as follow-up.Preferred experience:Experience as an administrator on Learning Management (LMS) platform preferred.Experience using training content editing tools preferred.10+ years related experience in the renewables, energy storage, or electric utility industry.Highly developed interpersonal skills with ability to interface with multiple levels of customer organizations.Strong understanding of business goals and standards for customer service.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment.Requires ability to physically bend, stand, walk, reach, climb ladders/steps, and lift up to 40 lbs.At Fluence we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace; if you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply!#inclusionmatters100% Remote#RemoteUnlimited PTOMedical, Dental, Vision, Life and Pet InsuranceGenerous 401K MatchAnnual Bonus IncentiveQuestions? Message your Talent Acquisition Directly: https://www.linkedin.com/in/marinagawlinski/Follow Fluence on LinkedIn: Fluence LinkedInFluence Career Page: Fluence CareersIn Colorado, the standard pay range for this role is $125k - 145K annually. This range is specific to Colorado and may not be applicable in other locations.Fluence IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or familial status.
